item.title: FCC Confiscates Remaining TV Channels For Twitter
item.description: The Federal Communications Commission (FCC), overwhelmed by the rapidly growing demand for wireless broadband, has seized control of all remaining broadcast television channels. This unexpected move aims to dedicate this valuable spectrum solely to Twitter. FCC Chairman Lowon B. Andwidth explained that a recent study revealed Twitter’s explosive growth will soon consume all available bandwidth. He expressed concern not only for the impact on internet browsing, video streaming, texting, and email, but also for the potential chaos if Twitter users experience posting delays.
